posts.author: wildleaf
posts.content:
Hello everyone, I just wanted to start a thread to talk acceptable behavior when playing on different PWs.

Recently a player joined a PW I play on and he was having a tough time. Instead of asking for help or pointers they started spamming the shout channel with their complaints. Here's an example of one of about a dozen messages they shouted:
Spoiler"DUDE my Toon is a ULTIMATE BAD AZZ 25 25 25 AC at 2nd Level with a Brown Bear and a SUMMON and a Henchie, do you have a y clue how awesomy bad azz good that is, how much better then the toon that handled WOG. But yet despite that, it still died to Kobolds. Post on the forums dude that a toon BETTER then the toon that oonly died 1,2,3,4 ti.mes, reached 18th lev defeated the temple of Elemental Evil on WOG, World of Greyhawk, the toughest PW, that the toon better then that toon at level 2 comparison that was, is better with a 25 AC at level 2, died 2 times to lousy kobolds here. They would say WTF, that PW must be tougher than WOG then. My toon is a basic simple Monk/Cleric/Druid A BEST that can get 25AC at level 2, A Brown Bear Animal Companiin, A SUMMON, and A Henchie, such a aweso.e b3st of the best out of level 2 toons should NOT die even once to kobols let alone 2 time, thats proof if how extremely tough tougher th3n WOG this PW is at level 1,2. TO TOUGH. Either tone it down or make it 15 to 100 gold to respawn instead of 500 gold to respawn at level 2 thats rediculous and burn tbru 2500 like it is nothing, and then level 2 toon can't earn gd, get exp, le el up, etc. because NOT ENOUGH GOLD TO PAY THE RESPAWN COST OF DYING. So because of that level 2 toon is SCREWED, and no way to get UNSCREWED, as thats how reiculously tough this PW is on level 2 toons. WOG wasnt even close to being this hard."
This is obviously unacceptable, and trust me when I say that this player was relentless in ignoring input from other players and continuing to spam the server. Please, don't act like this player.

Now, I wanted to outline a few important takeaways from using this forum and playing in online worlds, and hopefully we can flesh these points out together.

1) All builds will not work on all servers.

2) Ask for help, don't demand other players to bow to your whim.

3) Learn the rules on the PW you wish to play on. There is almost always a placard describing changes or a website for you to peruse. Don't jump in with a 1-40 plan without studying these changes, or you will often find yourself disappointed.

4) Don't complain or demand changes to other people's server's. Sure, you can be angry about a certain rule, but never take it out on others. Server owners have spent thousands of hours tweaking their worlds, and they know what works and what doesn't. If you wish to offer suggestions, do it through the proper channels, and never demand a change be made. You attract more flies with honey than vinegar.

5) Don't be condescending. If you believe you come from "the greatest PW", you're wrong. They're all equally great and they are what lend us the huge variety of play that we enjoy. Relish what we have now, because it won't be here forever.

6) Be kind. Give that new player your last set of hasted boots. Make friends. Help people achieve their goals. Guide people when they ask for help, never tell them how to play if they don't ask.

So, obviously this isn't polished (so help me out guys!), but these are my thoughts after seeing what happened last night. I've played this game since the original release, andI'm extremely grateful that it's experiencing this brief revival. I don't want to see it wasted.

Thanks everyone and have fun!

Sent from my SM-G955U using Tapatalk

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I have both been the Owner of a PW (which my team and I created) and I have DMed on several PWs (and was on the Staff).

Cases like you point out happen occassionally - you should have been around for the Golden days of NWN PWs online!  We'd get griefers like that all the time.

Most are kids - yeah, it is true.  Some are just griefers, and back then were using scripts and god 2das to crash servers and just cause mischief.

I think the Golden Rules apply everywhere (imo).

1. Respect others.
2. Have fun, but not at the expense of others.

That was basically the premise of my PW way back when, The Playground.  I feel that these two Golden Rules, if followed, basically will lead to everyone having their cake and eating it, too.

For hardcore RP PWs, there will be a lot of rules to follow beyond that, of course.  But I think those two rules are basic common sense and work if abided by.

As for the player build monk/cleric/druid, I seriously doubt that it was stomping on everything.  Not only does it get an XP penalty, but one, or both, spellcasters are definitely subject to dispel spam (which is pretty nasty on WoG).  I rather suspect that it is a Dragon build - but a Dragon build doesn't stomp on everything on WoG - especially not the major Bosses (nor many of their m0bs).

An AC of 25 at 2nd level is not anywhere near the apex, btw.  And since the build does not have any Uncanny Dodge, is seriously in danger of loosing Dex and Dodge AC (flatfooted).  And although the summons is rather good for that level, it is hardly a massive, undamageable tank.  The Animal Companion at that level also suffers from squishy.  The henchie mentioned is nice, but they are not available all over the place, and will not stand a chance against some of the more higher level areas.

It is pretty funny that the build in question is getting owned by kobolds!  Though there are some kobolds on WoG that would make the player scream as well, they are not for beginning levels.

But I digress here.

What PW was this on?  And what is up with those kobolds?
